summary: Owls are birds of prey from the Strigiformes order, with over 200 species. Most are solitary and hunt at night (nocturnal). They have excellent vision and hearing, sharp talons, and quiet flight feathers. There are two owl families: Strigidae (true owls) and Tytonidae (barn owls). Owls eat small mammals, insects, and other birds. Some hunt fish. They live everywhere except the polar ice caps and remote islands. A group of owls is called a "parliament."
title: Owl
